abstract: In seeking a new chairman for General Motors, the Obama administration turned to a longtime Republican fund-raiser, Edward E. Whitacre Jr., the former chief executive of AT&T.
snippet: In seeking a new chairman for General Motors, the Obama administration turned to a longtime Republican fund-raiser, Edward E. Whitacre Jr., the former chief executive of AT&T.
lead_paragraph: President Obama flexed his political muscle back in March when he sought, and received, the resignation of Rick Wagoner, the chairman and chief executive of General Motors. But when it came time to find a permanent replacement for Mr. Wagoner as chairman, being a loyal Democrat didn’t seem to have been much of a priority.

headline.main: In G.M.’s Chairman, a Choice Beyond Politics
